alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Hale; Hockley; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 10:22PM CDT until May 10 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following counties, Floyd, Hale, Hockley, Lamb and Lubbock. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1021 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to one half inch are expected over the area. The threat of significant flooding has passed though residual runoff is expected to continue through 1 AM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Plainview, Levelland, Hale Center, Shallowater, Lockney, Sundown, Anton, Cotton Center, Spade, Reese Center, Aiken, Smyer, Ropesville and Opdyke West. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
